BR_text.BRsummary: Nuget "Part URI cannot start with two forward slashes."
BR_text.BRdescription:
Describe the bug
 Added Microsoft.ML.OnnxRuntime to the nuget packages
 
 Part URI cannot start with two forward slashes.
 
 and
 
 An error occurred while retrieving package metadata for 'Microsoft.ML.OnnxRuntime.0.3.0' from source 'D:\development\EntityRecognition\packages'.
 
 System information
 
 OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Windows 10
 ONNX Runtime installed from (source or binary): binary nuget.org
 ONNX Runtime version: 0.3.0
 
 To Reproduce
 Added Microsoft.ML.OnnxRuntime to the nuget packages, now get this error and cannot list installed nugets
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aspnet/AspNetCore/issues/5798>This issue</denchmark-link>
  seems related

comments_0.comment_text:
This is in XML in nuget, may be related
 
 <Override PartName="//LICENSE" ContentType="application/octet" />

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dashesy>@dashesy</denchmark-link>
 , the PR below should resolve the double slashes in the [Content_Types].xml file within the NuGet package.
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/pull/669>#669</denchmark-link>
 .

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jignparm>@jignparm</denchmark-link>
  thanks. Is there any pre-release package I can try?

comments_4.comment_text: I tried the dev nuget and the issue is now resolved, thanks. I also had to remove the 0.3.0 from packages directory, to get rid of the error: it seems VS looks at all the packages trying to read metadata and if it cannot read metadata from an older one does not ignore it!

comments_5.comment_text: Thanks for confirming it's working after cleaning up the NuGet cache -- looks like stale packages can still have impact.
